text.0: A psalm of David, after he battled Goliath.
text.1: Young I was in the midst of my brothers, and a lad in my father’s house.
text.2: A shepherd of my father’s flock, driving his herd in the wilderness.
text.3: My hands performed upon a lute, my fingers worked a lyre.
text.4: And who can tell Adonai? Adonai – He will hear.
text.5: He sent His messenger, and took me from after my father’s flock.
text.6: And He anointed me with anointing oil, and appointed me a prince of my people.
text.7: My brothers are good and strong, but them Adonai did not desire.
text.8: He took me out towards the Philistine, who cursed me through his idols.
text.9: And I tore off his sword, and cut off his head, and removed reproach from the children of Israel.
